wikipedia_page.main: Charles Flood (18 July 1896 – 14 November 1978) was an English first-class cricketer who played for Sir Julien Cahn's XI in various matches from 1929 to 1937 and for the Combined Services in 1943. A wicket-keeper, he toured South America in the winter of 1929–30 with Cahn's XI. He was born in Newport, Isle of Wight and died in Beverley, Yorkshire.
